titles.title: To amend the Water Resources Development Act of 1990 to extend the authority of the Secretary of the Army to carry out certain construction projects in the Virgin Islands.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Public Works + Transportation.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Water Resources and Environment.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Subcommittee on Water Resources and Environment Discharged.
Reported by the Committee on Public Works + Transportation. H. Rept. 103-234.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 128.

action.text: Mr. Traficant moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

term.name: Federal aid to water resources development

bill.summary: 6/9/1993--Introduced. Amends the Water Resources Development Act of 1990 to make permanent (currently, expires November 28, 1993) the authority of the Secretary of the Army to carry out certain construction projects in the Virgin Islands.
